name: Please Forgive Me, I'm Dumb
description:
I don’t want to watch TV
Even through the empty, processed laugh tracks
Or the ‘captivating’ stories, waiting to be recycled.

But these sleepless nights have become so damning.
Ears ring within in the deafening silence
And my thoughts perverse with garbage. 

Growing comfortable in discomfort,
While looking up to false prophets
In search for signs of hope, inside a tiny screen.

I’m grasping onto a shimmering light
In a darkness that swallows me, whole…
Watching TV is just so terribly bleak.

But curious eyes peek through the unholy window.
Fixated –worshipping ideologues,
That sell fast dreams, only to help push their own agenda.

And I’m caught blinded by its light.
